content.question: At the current prices of goods X and Y, the quantity demanded of good X is 10 units, and the quantity demanded of good Y is 5 units. The cross-price elasticity of demand between goods X and Y is 0.6. A 10 percent increase in the price of good Y will result in which of the following?

choices.label: A 0.5 percent decrease in the quantity demanded of good Y.
A 3 percent increase in the quantity demanded of good Y.
A 1 percent increase in the quantity demanded of good X.
A 6 percent increase in the quantity demanded of good X.
A 60 percent increase in the quantity demanded of good X.

content.answer: A 6 percent increase in the quantity demanded of good X.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
